meanings.definition: To move or throw suddenly and rapidly.
meanings.sent1: She dartles across the playground to catch the ball.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel dartles up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent3: The cat dartles around the room, chasing after a laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: His eyes dartle around the room, searching for the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The lightning dartles across the sky, illuminating the dark clouds.

meanings.sent1: He dartles when he hears a sudden loud noise.
meanings.sent2: The baby dartles at the sight of a bug crawling on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected prank made her dartle in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The horse dartles nervously as the fireworks go off.
meanings.sent5: The student dartles in his seat when the teacher calls on him unexpectedly.
